title: FedRAMP System Assessment Submission
description: JSON Schema for Cloud Service Provider (CSP) system submission for FedRAMP authorization. This is a notional draft and SHOULD NOT BE USED BY ANYONE!!!!

serviceName.title: Service Name
serviceName.description: Full name of the cloud service being authorized

serviceAcronym.title: Service Acronym
serviceAcronym.description: Short acronym or abbreviation for the service

providerName.title: Provider Name
providerName.description: Name of the Cloud Service Provider

serviceDescription.title: Service Description
serviceDescription.description: A brief description of the service being authorized

repositories.title: Repositories
repositories.description: List of repository locations for the system. Repositories hold information about the system authorization including KSI responses, security assessment reports, and other relevant documents.

authenticationRequired.title: Authentication Required
authenticationRequired.description: Whether authentication is required to access the repository

accessRequestInstructions.title: Access Request Instructions
accessRequestInstructions.description: Instructions for requesting access to the repository

impactLevel.title: Impact Level
impactLevel.description: FedRAMP impact level of the service being authorized

status.title: Authorization Status
status.description: Current authorization status of the system

dateAuthorized.title: Date of Authorization
dateAuthorized.description: Date when FedRAMP authorization was granted or the system was first authorized for continuous monitoring

contactInformation.title: Contact Information
contactInformation.description: Key contacts for the FedRAMP assessment

primaryContact.title: Primary Contact
primaryContact.description: Primary point of contact for the FedRAMP assessment

securityContact.title: Security Contact
securityContact.description: Point of contact for security-related questions

keySecurityIndicators.$comment: The vibe here is that for each KSI the CSP will list 1 - n security objectives. For each objective they will list 1 - n achievements. An achievement is a specific design choice, process, or other measure that meets the objective. For each achievement they will list 1 - n objectiveMonitoring which are specific tests that validate the achievement. Finally each objectiveMonitoring will list 1 - n evidence. which will be the actual output of the test. I am anticipating that there will be a lot of repetition here. The CSP SHOULD either use native JSON constructs like $ref or if they are managing the data in another system then they can simply output the repetitive data. Although that will make the JSON MUCH bigger so maybe we should encourage the use of $ref. and have a separate file for each of these elements?
keySecurityIndicators.title: Key Security Indicators
keySecurityIndicators.description: Key Security Indicators for FedRAMP assessment

KSI-AFR-01.title: KSI-AFR-01 Minimum Assessment Scope
KSI-AFR-01.description:
Apply the FedRAMP Minimum Assessment Standard (MAS) to identify and document the scope of the cloud service offering to be assessed for FedRAMP authorization and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/minimum-assessment-scope

KSI-AFR-02.title: KSI-AFR-02 Key Security Indicators
KSI-AFR-02.description:
Set security goals for the cloud service offering based on FedRAMP 20x Phase Two Key Security Indicators (KSIs - you are here), develop automated validation of status and progress to the greatest extent possible, and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/key-security-indicators

KSI-AFR-03.title: KSI-AFR-03 Authorization Data Sharing
KSI-AFR-03.description:
Determine how authorization data will be shared with all necessary parties in alignment with the FedRAMP Authorization Data Sharing (ADS) standard and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/authorization-data-sharing

KSI-AFR-04.title: KSI-AFR-04 Vulnerability Detection and Response
KSI-AFR-04.description:
Document the vulnerability detection and vulnerability response methodology used within the cloud service offering in alignment with the FedRAMP Vulnerability Detection and Response (VDR) standard and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/vulnerability-detection-and-response

KSI-AFR-05.title: KSI-AFR-05 Significant Change Notifications
KSI-AFR-05.description:
Determine how significant changes will be tracked and how all necessary parties will be notified in alignment with the FedRAMP Significant Change Notifications (SCN) standard and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/significant-change-notifications

KSI-AFR-06.title: KSI-AFR-06 Collaborative Continuous Monitoring
KSI-AFR-06.description:
Maintain a plan and process for providing Ongoing Authorization Reports and Quarterly Reviews for all necessary parties in alignment with the FedRAMP Collaborative Continuous Monitoring (CCM) standard and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/collaborative-continuous-monitoring

KSI-AFR-07.title: KSI-AFR-07 Recommended Secure Configuration
KSI-AFR-07.description:
Develop secure by default configurations and provide guidance for secure configuration of the cloud service offering to customers in alignment with the FedRAMP Recommended Secure Configuration (RSC) guidance standard and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/recommended-secure-configuration

KSI-AFR-08.title: KSI-AFR-08 FedRAMP Security Inbox
KSI-AFR-08.description:
Operate a secure inbox to receive critical communication from FedRAMP and other government entities in alignment with FedRAMP Security Inbox (FSI) requirements and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/fedramp-security-inbox

KSI-AFR-09.title: KSI-AFR-09 Persistent Validation and Assessment
KSI-AFR-09.description:
Persistently validate, assess, and report on the effectiveness and status of security decisions and policies that are implemented within the cloud service offering in alignment with the FedRAMP 20x Persistent Validation and Assessment (PVA) standard, and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/persistent-validation-and-assessment

KSI-AFR-10.title: KSI-AFR-10 Incident Communications Procedures
KSI-AFR-10.description:
Integrate FedRAMP's Incident Communications Procedures (ICP) into incident response procedures and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/incident-communications-procedures

KSI-AFR-11.title: KSI-AFR-11 Using Cryptographic Modules
KSI-AFR-11.description:
Ensure that cryptographic modules used to protect potentially sensitive federal customer data are selected and used in alignment with the FedRAMP 20x Using Cryptographic Modules (UCM) policy and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
https://fedramp.gov/docs/using-cryptographic-modules

KSI-CED-01.title: KSI-CED-01 General Education
KSI-CED-01.description: Require and monitor the effectiveness of training given to all employees on policies, procedures, and security-related topics.

KSI-CED-02.title: KSI-CED-02 Role-Specific Education
KSI-CED-02.description: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training for high risk roles, including at least roles with privileged access.

KSI-CED-03.title: KSI-CED-03 Development and Engineering Education
KSI-CED-03.description: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training provided to development and engineering staff that covers best practices for delivering secure software.

KSI-CED-04.title: KSI-CED-04 Incident Response and Disaster Recovery Education
KSI-CED-04.description: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training to staff involved with incident response or disaster recovery.

KSI-CMT-01.title: KSI-CMT-01 Log and Monitor Changes
KSI-CMT-01.description: Log and monitor modifications to the cloud service offering.

KSI-CMT-02.title: KSI-CMT-02 Redeployment
KSI-CMT-02.description: Execute changes though redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible

KSI-CMT-03.title: KSI-CMT-03 Automated Testing and Validation
KSI-CMT-03.description: Automate persistent testing and validation of changes throughout deployment.

KSI-CMT-04.title: KSI-CMT-04 Change Management Procedure
KSI-CMT-04.description: Always follow a documented change management procedure.

KSI-CNA-01.title: KSI-CNA-01 Restrict Network Traffic
KSI-CNA-01.description: Configure all machine-based information resources to limit inbound and outbound network traffic.

KSI-CNA-02.title: KSI-CNA-02 Minimize the Attack Surface
KSI-CNA-02.description: Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised.

KSI-CNA-03.title: KSI-CNA-03 Enforce Traffic Flow
KSI-CNA-03.description: Use logical networking and related capabilities to enforce traffic flow controls.

KSI-CNA-04.title: KSI-CNA-04 Immutable Infrastructure
KSI-CNA-04.description: Use immutable infrastructure with strictly defined functionality and privileges by default.

KSI-CNA-05.title: KSI-CNA-05 Unwanted Activity
KSI-CNA-05.description: Protect against denial of service attacks and other unwanted activity.

KSI-CNA-06.title: KSI-CNA-06 High Availability
KSI-CNA-06.description: Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery.

KSI-CNA-07.title: KSI-CNA-07 Best Practices
KSI-CNA-07.description: Ensure cloud-native _information resources_ are implemented based on host provider's best practices and documented guidance.

KSI-CNA-08.title: KSI-CNA-08 Persistent Assessment and Automated Enforcement
KSI-CNA-08.description: Use automated services to persistently assess the security posture of all machine-based information resources and automatically enforce their intended operational state.

KSI-IAM-01.title: KSI-IAM-01 Phishing-Resistant MFA
KSI-IAM-01.description: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) using methods that are difficult to intercept or impersonate (phishing-resistant MFA) for all user authentication.

KSI-IAM-02.title: KSI-IAM-02 Passwordless Authentication
KSI-IAM-02.description: Use secure passwordless methods for user authentication and authorization when feasible, otherwise enforce strong passwords with MFA.

KSI-IAM-03.title: KSI-IAM-03 Non-User Accounts
KSI-IAM-03.description: Enforce appropriately secure authentication methods for non-user accounts and services.

KSI-IAM-04.title: KSI-IAM-04 Just-in-Time Authorization
KSI-IAM-04.description: Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time security authorization model for all user and non-user accounts and services.

KSI-IAM-05.title: KSI-IAM-05 Least Privilege
KSI-IAM-05.description: Configure identity and access management with measures that always verify each user or device can only access the resources they need.

KSI-IAM-06.title: KSI-IAM-06 Suspicious Activity
KSI-IAM-06.description: Automatically disable or otherwise secure accounts with privileged access in response to suspicious activity

KSI-IAM-07.title: KSI-IAM-07 Automated Account Management
KSI-IAM-07.description: Securely manage the lifecycle and privileges of all accounts, roles, and groups, using automation.

KSI-INR-01.title: KSI-INR-01 Incident Response Procedure
KSI-INR-01.description: Always follow a documented incident response procedure.

KSI-INR-02.title: KSI-INR-02 Incident Logging
KSI-INR-02.description: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities.

KSI-INR-03.title: KSI-INR-03 Incident After Action Reports
KSI-INR-03.description: Generate after action reports and _regularly_ incorporate lessons learned into operations.

KSI-MLA-01.title: KSI-MLA-01 Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)
KSI-MLA-01.description: Operate a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) or similar system(s) for centralized, tamper-resistent logging of events, activities, and changes.

KSI-MLA-05.title: KSI-MLA-05 Infrastructure as Code
KSI-MLA-05.description: Perform Infrastructure as Code and configuration evaluation and testing.

KSI-MLA-07.title: KSI-MLA-07 Event Types
KSI-MLA-07.description: Maintain a list of information resources and event types that will be monitored, logged, and audited, then do so.

KSI-MLA-08.title: KSI-MLA-08 Log Data Access
KSI-MLA-08.description: Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time access authorization model for access to log data based on organizationally defined data sensitivity.

KSI-PIY-01.title: KSI-PIY-01 Automated Inventory
KSI-PIY-01.description: Use authoritative sources to automatically maintain real-time inventories of all information resources.

KSI-PIY-02.title: KSI-PIY-02 Security Objectives and Requirements
KSI-PIY-02.description: Document the security objectives and requirements for each information resource or set of information resources.

KSI-PIY-04.title: KSI-PIY-04 CISA Secure By Design
KSI-PIY-04.description: Monitor the effectiveness of building security and privacy considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle and aligning with CISA Secure By Design principles.

KSI-PIY-05.title: KSI-PIY-05 Evaluate Implementations
KSI-PIY-05.description: Document methods used to evaluate _information resource_ implementations.

KSI-PIY-06.title: KSI-PIY-06 Security Investment Effectiveness
KSI-PIY-06.description: Monitor the effectiveness of the organization's investments in achieving security objectives.

KSI-PIY-07.title: KSI-PIY-07 Supply Chain Risk Management
KSI-PIY-07.description: Document risk management decisions for software supply chain security.

KSI-PIY-08.title: KSI-PIY-08 Executive Support
KSI-PIY-08.description: Regularly measure executive support for achieving the organization’s security objectives.

KSI-RPL-01.title: KSI-RPL-01 Recovery Objectives
KSI-RPL-01.description: Define Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO).

KSI-RPL-02.title: KSI-RPL-02 Recovery Plan
KSI-RPL-02.description: Develop and maintain a recovery plan that aligns with the defined recovery objectives.

KSI-RPL-03.title: KSI-RPL-03 System Backups
KSI-RPL-03.description: Perform system backups aligned with recovery objectives.

KSI-RPL-04.title: KSI-RPL-04 Recovery Testing
KSI-RPL-04.description: _Regularly_ test the capability to recover from incidents and contingencies.

KSI-SVC-01.title: KSI-SVC-01 Continuous Improvement
KSI-SVC-01.description: Implement improvements based on persistent evaluation of information resources for opportunities to improve security.

KSI-SVC-02.title: KSI-SVC-02 Network Encryption
KSI-SVC-02.description: Encrypt or otherwise secure network traffic.

KSI-SVC-04.title: KSI-SVC-04 Configuration Automation
KSI-SVC-04.description: Manage configuration of machine-based information resources using automation.

KSI-SVC-05.title: KSI-SVC-05 Resource Integrity
KSI-SVC-05.description: Use cryptographic methods to validate the integrity of machine-based information resources.

KSI-SVC-06.title: KSI-SVC-06 Secret Management
KSI-SVC-06.description: Automate management, protection, and regular rotation of digital keys, certificates, and other secrets.

KSI-SVC-07.title: KSI-SVC-07 Patching
KSI-SVC-07.description: Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches.

KSI-SVC-08.title: KSI-SVC-08 Shared Resources
KSI-SVC-08.description: Do not introduce or leave behind residual elements that could negatively affect confidentiality, integrity, or availability of _federal customer data_ during operations.

KSI-SVC-09.title: KSI-SVC-09 Communication Integrity
KSI-SVC-09.description: Persistently validate the authenticity and integrity of communications between _machine-based_ _information resources_ using automation.

KSI-SVC-10.title: KSI-SVC-10 Data Destruction
KSI-SVC-10.description: Remove unwanted federal customer data promptly when requested by an agency in alignment with customer agreements, including from backups if appropriate; this typically applies when a customer spills information or when a customer seeks to remove information from a service due to a change in usage.

KSI-TPR-03.title: KSI-TPR-03 Supply Chain Risk Management
KSI-TPR-03.description: Identify and prioritize mitigation of potential supply chain risks.

KSI-TPR-04.title: KSI-TPR-04 Supply Chain Risk Monitoring
KSI-TPR-04.description: Automatically monitor third party software _information resources_ for upstream vulnerabilities using mechanisms that may include contractual notification requirements or active monitoring services.

securityStatement.title: Security Statement
examples: The company's network is segmented to prevent unauthorized access to customer data.
The company management has established defined roles and responsibilities to oversee the design and implementation of information security controls.

responsibleParty.title: Responsible Party(s)
responsibleParty.description: Teams or individuals responsible for achieving the security objective

description.title: Control Description
description.description: Detailed explanation of how the security objective is achieved.

responsibleParty.title: Responsible Party(s)
responsibleParty.description: Teams or individuals responsible for implementing the security control

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: Frequency of monitoring the security objective

method.title: Monitoring Method
method.description: Specific method used to monitor the security objective.

automated.title: Automated
automated.description: Whether the monitoring method is automated

evidenceLocation.title: Evidence Location
evidenceLocation.description: URI or file path to the evidence document

evidenceContent.title: Evidence Content (base64 encoded)
evidenceContent.description: Base64 encoded content of the evidence document

evidenceText.title: Evidence Content (Text)
evidenceText.description: Evidence included as plain text such as the output of a command or log.

lastUpdated.title: Last Updated
lastUpdated.description: Date when the evidence was last updated
